Description: Head of female terracotta figure wearing her hair in 'melon style', following Tanagra types (Melonenfrisur - sections radiating from head; in back part covered by moulded wreath with diagonal striations). Mould-made and solid. Originally covered with thick white coating but now partly worn with a friable surface. Relatively coarse, sandy, slightly micaceous orange Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from Naukratis in the British Museum (GR1886,0401.1418), Bristol Museum (H840) and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA542, NA547). Copy of Greek 'Tanagras' (Bailey 2008, 141, see also no.3524, GR1926,0930.12), with close Egyptian parallels purchased at Memphis (Petrie et al. 1910, pl. 44, no. 155 and 161, Petrie Museum UC48475), in Tübingen (Fischer 1994, nos. 77, 94) dating from the end of the 4th to 3rd century BC. Similar hair treatment in Egyptian figurines is dated from early to the third quarter of 3rd century BC by Török (1995, no. 214, 215). Mid to late 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, no. 201). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Petrie, W. M. F. MacKay, E and Wainwright, G. 1910. Memphis, vol III: Meydum and Memphis. London. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma. Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.358) (Phase 1)
